52. Layout¶

class optcom.layout.Layout(domain=<optcom.domain.Domain object>, name='Layout')¶

Represent an optical system.

The layout is represented as a graph, i.e. set of components linked together by either unidirectionnal or bidirectionnal edges. The components contain the information on their neighbors, i.e. to which components and ports they are linked to.

domain¶

The domain which the layout is bound to.

Type

Domain

name¶

The name of the Layout.

Type

str

Parameters

  • domain (Domain) -- The domain which the layout is bound to.

  • name (str) -- The name of the layout.

add_comp(*comps)¶

Add a component in the Layout.

Parameters

comps (AbstractComponent) -- A series of components to be added.

Return type

None

del_link(*links)¶

Delete a series of edges in the Layout.

Parameters

links (Tuple[Tuple[AbstractComponent, int], Tuple[AbstractComponent, int]]) -- Each tuple of the list contains the components to be linked as well as their respective ports.

Return type

None

static get_degree(comp)¶

Return the degree of the component.

Parameters

comp (AbstractComponent) -- The component to be checked

Return type

int

Returns

Degree of the component given as parameter.

static get_leafs(comps)¶

Return the leafs of the Layout in the list given as parameter

Parameters

comps (List[AbstractComponent]) -- Components to be checked if they are leafs of the Layout.

Return type

List[AbstractComponent]

Returns

Components which are leafs of the Layout.

link(*links)¶

Add a series of bidirectionnal edges in the Layout.

Parameters

links (Tuple[Tuple[AbstractComponent, int], Tuple[AbstractComponent, int]]) -- Each tuple of the list contains the components to be linked as well as their respective ports.

Return type

None

link_unidir(*links)¶

Add a series of unidirectionnal edges in the Layout

Parameters

links (Tuple[Tuple[AbstractComponent, int], Tuple[AbstractComponent, int]]) -- Each tuple of the list contains the components to be linked as well as their respective ports.

Return type

None

reset()¶

Reset (i.e. empty) the Layout.

Return type

None

run(*starter_comps)¶

Launch the simulation.

Parameters

starter_comps (AbstractStartComp) -- The components from which the simulation starts.

Return type

None

53. Taylor¶

class optcom.utils.taylor.Taylor¶

Represent a Taylor series.

static series(derivative, x_diff, start=0, stop=None)¶

Calculate the Taylor series according to the given parameters.

Parameters

  • derivative (numpy.ndarray of float) -- The derivatives of the function to approximate.

  • x_diff (numpy.ndarray of float) -- The values of the variables.

Returns

Taylor series evaluation.

Return type

float

Notes

\[\begin{split}f(x) &= \sum_{n=0}^N \frac{f_n}{n!} (x - x_0)^n \quad \text{where} \quad f_n = \left. \frac{d^n f}{dx^n} \right\rvert_{x = x_0}\\\end{split}\]

54. Domain¶

class optcom.domain.Domain(bits=1, bit_width=100.0, samples_per_bit=512, memory_storage=1.0)¶

Contain shared information about fields propagating in the layout.

bits¶

Number of bits to consider.

Type

int

samples¶

Total number of samples per signal.

Type

int

time¶

Absolute time values for any signal.

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

dtime¶

The time step size.

Type

float

time_window¶

The time window.

Type

float

omega¶

Absolute angular frequency values for any signal.

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

domega¶

The angular frequency step size.

Type

float

omega_window¶

The angular frequency window.

Type

float

nu¶

Absolute frequency values for any signal.

Type

numpy.ndarray of float

dnu¶

The frequency step size.

Type

float

nu_window¶

The frequency window.

Type

float

Parameters

  • bits (int) -- Number of bits to consider.

  • bit_width (float) -- The width of one bit. \([ps]\)

  • samples_per_bit (int) -- Number of samples per bit.

  • memory_storage (float) -- Max memory available if recording all steps of computation. Will be used if the attribute save_all of AbstractComponent is True. \([Gb]\)

static lambda_bw_to_nu_bw(lambda_bw, center_lambda)¶

Convert the wavelength bandwidth to frequency bandwidth.

Parameters

  • lambda_bw (float) -- The wavelength bandwidth. \([nm]\)

  • center_lambda (float) -- The center wavelength. \([nm]\)

Return type

float

Returns

The frequency bandwidth. \([THz]\)

Notes

\[\Delta \nu = \frac{c}{\lambda_0^2}\Delta\lambda\]
static lambda_bw_to_omega_bw(lambda_bw, center_lambda)¶

Convert the wavelength bandwidth to angular frequency bandwidth.

Parameters

  • lambda_bw (float) -- The wavelength bandwidth. \([nm]\)

  • center_lambda (float) -- The center wavelength. \([nm]\)

Return type

float

Returns

The angular frequency bandwidth. \([rad\cdot ps^{-1}]\)

Notes

\[\Delta\omega = \frac{2\pi c}{\lambda_0^2}\Delta\lambda\]

55. Abstract Component¶

class optcom.components.abstract_component.AbstractComponent(name, default_name, ports_type, save, wait=False, max_nbr_pass=None)¶

Parent of any component object. Represent a node of the layout graph.

name¶

The name of the component.

Type

str

ports_type¶

Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

Type

list of int

save¶

If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

Type

bool

Parameters

  • name (str) -- The name of the component.

  • default_name (str) -- The default name of the component.

  • ports_type (List[int]) -- Type of each port of the component, give also the number of ports in the component. For types, see optcom/utils/constant_values/port_types.

  • save (bool) -- If True, will save each field going through each port. The recorded fields can be accessed with the attribute fields.

  • wait (bool) -- If True, will wait for specified waiting port policy added with the function AbstractComponent.add_wait_policy().

  • max_nbr_pass (Optional[List[int]]) -- If not None, no fields will be propagated if the number of fields which passed through a specific port exceed the specified maximum number of pass for this port.

class Times(nbr_ports)¶

Container for time array storage.

add_port_policy(*policy)¶

Append a new policy to automatically designate output port depending on the input port.

Parameters

policy (Tuple[List[int], List[int], bool]) -- The policy (a, b, flag) assigns input ports in list a to output ports in list b. If flag is True, also assign input ports of b to output ports of a. If there is -1 in list b, the field entering at the corresponding port in list a will not be transmitted. N.B.: if (len(a) < len(b)), pad b with length of a. len(a) must be >= len(b)

Return type

None

add_wait_policy(*policy)¶

Append a new policy to automatically make a port waiting for other port(s).

Parameters

policy (List[int]) -- The number(s) in the list correspond to the port number(s) which have to wait for each others.

Return type

None

output_ports(input_ports)¶

Return a list of the corresponding output port(s) to the specified input port(s) depending on all ports in the provided list.

Parameters

input_ports (List[int]) -- The inputs ports.

Return type

List[int]

Returns

The output ports.
